## Install

```bash
npm i -D eslint-config-aqua
```

## Usage

Add the ESLint config to your `package.json`:

```json
{
	"name": "my-project",
	...
	"eslintConfig": {
		"extends": "aqua"
	}
}
```

Or to `eslintrc.js` or `eslintrc.json`:

```json
{
	"extends": "aqua"
}
```

# Targets

If you are developing with Javascript in the browser consider adding:

```json
{
	"env": {
		"browser": true
	}
}
```

or use the platform specific configs for Node.js:

```json
{
	"extends": "aqua/node"
}
```

or Svelte:

```json
{
	"extends": "aqua/svelte"
}
```

or React:

```json
{
	"extends": "aqua/react"
}
```

or any other JSX:

```json
{
	"extends": "aqua/jsx"
}
```

or Vue.js:

```json
{
	"extends": "aqua/vue"
}
```

Using the Vue extended config will require you to additionally install `eslint-plugin-vue` and `babel-eslint`

```bash
npm i -D babel-eslint eslint-plugin-vue
```
